Package gchess.boardgame

Class Player<T extends BoardGame>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gchess.boardgame.Player<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The game that the player is compatible playing.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChessPlayer

    public abstract class Player<T extends BoardGame>
extends java.lang.Object

    Player

    A player is the entity that communicates with the BoardGamePlatform. What it does is to give a move every time the game platform ask from it. A player is either a human or a computer.
    Since:
    2018-04-23
    See Also:
    BoardGamePlatform

      abstract Move getNextMove​(T game)
      This function is called by the board-game platform as a request for a move from the player.
      abstract void onGameEnded​(T game)
      This function is called by the board-game platform after the game has ended.
      abstract void onGameStarted​(T game)
      This function is called by the board-game platform when the game initially started.
      abstract void onPlayerMadeMove​(T game)
      This function is called by the board-game platform when after of the players of the game has made a move.

    • Method Detail

      • onPlayerMadeMove

        public abstract void onPlayerMadeMove​(T game)
        This function is called by the board-game platform when after of the players of the game has made a move.
        Parameters:
        game - The current game (after the move).

      • onGameStarted

        public abstract void onGameStarted​(T game)
        This function is called by the board-game platform when the game initially started.
        Parameters:
        game - The current game.

      • getNextMove

        public abstract Move getNextMove​(T game)
        This function is called by the board-game platform as a request for a move from the player.
        Parameters:
        game - The current game (feel free to get any data from the game and make any changes you want as it is only a copy of the game).

      • onGameEnded

        public abstract void onGameEnded​(T game)
        This function is called by the board-game platform after the game has ended.
        Parameters:
        game - The current game.
